definition: emptiness/void/abstract theory or guiding principles/empty or unoccupied/diffident or timid/false/humble or modest/(of health) weak/virtual/in vain
abbr. for Yupian 玉篇[Yu4 pian1] and Guangyun 廣韻|广韵[Guang3 yun4]
(cf Book of Songs) How to fashion an ax handle? You need an ax/fig. to follow a principle/fig. to act as matchmaker
to spend a long time thinking about sth while unable to reach a decision
a black stallion or possibly a yellow mare (idiom); don't judge by outward appearance
lit. piles of work and papers (idiom); fig. accumulated backlog of work
(feng shui) beneficial influence, esp. from one's ancestral graves/to confer a beneficial influence
to understand tacitly (idiom)/to know intuitively/to understand thoroughly
to be too petty or insignificant to mention/to not be worth mentioning (idiom)
lit. to tune one's zither then play it; fig. to live by the consequences of one's actions/to make one's bed then lie on it
